content.description: The start is a little loose and you wander up using various holds and maybe part of a grungy crack on your left.  As you work towards the top, the anchor can be seen on the wall on the left.
content.protection: 4 bolts with gated shut anchors which share with route to right.
content.location: Second route from the far right side of the wall and just right of a grungy crack system.

content.description:
Third route from the left in the corridor between the boulder and the main face.

Difficult tricky start, with good moves and the occasional jug. Easily as good as any route on the Raven Rock formation.

This is the leftmost route on the White Face, just left of

Stemroids

, and serves as the warmup for the wall.

Make some bouldery moves to get established on the rock and then climb the face above on a mixture of jugs and edges to finish on a small ledge with anchors.

Better quality than its neighbor to the left and slightly more difficult.  Follow up overlap holds with lots of featured holds for your hands and feet.

Good route for the beginner leader.
content.protection: 4 bolts to gated shut anchors which share with the route to the left
content.location: First route on far right side of wall.

content.description:
A series of balancy liebacks lead up to and past the first bolt, after which easier moves in the middle of the route lead to yet more liebacking past the third bolt, all of which should get you loosened up for the funky crux. Clip the last bolt, take a deep breath, and then commit to a series of awkward moves above the bolt with some good air potential if you pitch.

Technical and off-balance moves make this climb seem harder than it is, which is perhaps why it's not as popular as the neighboring routes.
content.location:
This is the second route from the left and is located between

White Head

and

White Out

.

content.description:
The start of this route is a bit steep with the first bolt being a bit further up than the typical NJC route.  After the bouldery start the route thins and steepens around bolts 4 & 5 as you gain the top.

Route described with no stars in the Mayr guidebook.  However, the technical moves and featured rock give it two stars in my book.
content.location:
This route can be found 3 routes from the right end of the crag and starts just right of a large hueco feature.

Listed in Mayr guide as route 742
